text: thumb|Map of the Peruvian departments by HDI in 2017. Legend: This is a list of Peruvian regions by Human Development Index as of 2020 with data for the year 2018. {| class="wikitable sortable" !Rank !Region (Department) !HDI (2018) !Comparable country |- ! colspan="4" style="color:#090;" |Very high human development |- |1 |West (Ancash, Lima, Callao) |0.816 |, , |- ! colspan="4" style="color:#0c0;" |High human development |- |2 |South (Tacna, Moquegua, Arequipa, Ica, Ayacucho) |0.779 |, |- style="background:#e6e6e6" |– | (average) |0.759 |, |- |3 |North (Tumbes, Piura, Lambayeque, Cajamarca, La Libertad) |0.728 | |- |4 |Central (Huancavelica, Huanuco, Junín, Pasco) |0.715 | |- |5 |North East (Amazonas, Loreto, San Martín, Ucayali) |0.700 | |- ! colspan="4" style="color:#fc0;" |Medium Human Development |- |6 |East (Madre de Dios, Cusco, Puno, Apurimac) |0.699 | |} == See also == * List of countries by Human Development Index == References == Human Development Index Peru Peru
title: List of regions of Peru by Human Development Index
